result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua B Rhode was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of the two.  When not fully engaged, complete 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.  

No contact with A.S. unless approved by agent for child care.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete SAFE program intake.  Complete AODA and follow through.  Complete counseling, assessment, treatment deemed necessary by agent.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 10:26am
State appears by ADA Matthew Adrian; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Andrew Boden.

COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 (Bail Jumping-felony-repeater):10 months MCJ. Ct. 3 (Battery- repeater- domestic abuse):10 months MCJ. Ct. 4 (Disorderly conduct- repeater- domestic abuse):10 months MCJ. Ct. 6 (Disorderly conduct- repeater- domestic abuse):10 months MCJ. All counts of jail are to run concurrent to each other. Credit granted for 172 days on each count. Jail may be with huber release for work or treatment if meets jail criteria. COURT allowing 6 hour furlough for deft to make arrangements to obtain vehicle to obtain belongings in Antigo; agent needs to be aware of furlough. Outstanding costs be paid as condition of probation.

CONDITIONS: Complete SAFE program intake. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. No contact with A.S., unless approved by agent for child care. Compelete any assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent. COURT ORDERS: 14CF444 Ct. 2 Battery- repeater- domestic abuse: Serve 9 months MCJ. 62 days credit granted. Jail time can be served with huber release for work, school, treatment, or child care if meets jail criteria. Huber may include up to 4 hours of time to move property from ACE Hardware.
